description: Gets information about all of the versions of an intent. The GetIntentVersions operation returns an IntentMetadata object for each version of an intent. For example, if an intent has three numbered versions, the GetIntentVersions operation returns four IntentMetadata objects in the response, one for each numbered version and one for the $LATEST version. The GetIntentVersions operation always returns at least one version, the $LATEST version. This operation requires permissions for the lex:GetIntentVersions action.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the intent for which versions should be returned.

nested_items.name: intents
nested_items.description: An array of IntentMetadata objects, one for each numbered version of the intent plus one for the $LATEST version.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedDate
nested_items.description: The date that the intent was updated. When you create an intent, the creation date and last updated date are the same.

nested_items.name: createdDate
nested_items.description: The date that the intent was created.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: A pagination token for fetching the next page of intent versions. If the response to this call is truncated, Amazon Lex returns a pagination token in the response. To fetch the next page of versions, specify the pagination token in the next request.
